Bases: problib.probability.distributions.Distribution

cdf(x)¶

return cdf(x) = Pr(x <= X)

return pdf(x) = density(x)

class problib.probability.distributions.Binomial(n, p)¶

Bases: problib.probability.distributions.Distribution

consider indexing probabilities at different values for later access. precompute could be cheap and save time later, or could expensive and never really used. have to compare the options

cdf(x, index=False)¶

iteratively (naively) compute P(X <= x)

mean()¶

distribution mean

pdf(x)¶

return pdf(x) = density(x)

sample(n=1)¶

naive implementation (for now). meant to be used with relatively small n. consider poisson sampling for sufficiently large n

variance()¶

distribution variance

class problib.probability.distributions.Distribution(*params)¶

Bases: object

Consider extending base class to Continuous and Discrete subclasses. There are some slight differences that might matter to the API (e.g. “pdf” vs “pmf”)

cdf(x)¶

return cdf(x) = Pr(x <= X)

mean()¶

distribution mean

pdf(x)¶

return pdf(x) = density(x)

quantile(x)¶

return cdf^{-1}(p) = [Pr(x <= X) == p]

sample(n)¶

n: number of samples

distribution variance
